item.description:
On Monday nights Heritage Farm Ice Cream of Lowell puts on FREE concerts across the street at The Sampas pavilion. They also sponsor a classic car show (begins at 6pm) -cars from days gone by. Full schedule is here: http://heritagefarmicecream.com/index.php?link=11

Let's put boats in at the Lowell ramp just upstream from the Brunswick bowling lanes. Paddle downstream about 1 1/2 miles to the Sampas Pavilion and idle there to enjoy the music. Be sure to bring stern lights and a headlamp for safety. Bug spray, some snacks and beverages would be wise as well. Also, there is a landing ramp alongside the park with a whopping 500' walk to yummy ice cream! Total paddle length will be a torturous 5 miles if we're lucky. If you're late, don't worry. Hit the water, take a left and listen for music. If you go over the Pawtucket falls, you went too far. (..and maybe you're deaf too. Bummer.)
As always, my cell is 603.557.6055

Those who know me - I don't have a problem getting wet. If it rains though, the live music doesn't happen since this is an open air venue. We'll cancel the event and try again next Monday


Featured this week: THE MIGHTY BAD HABITS

The Mighty Bad Habits continue to soar to new heights playing rock & roll, funk, and the blues in it's purest form. The Mighty Bad habits have proven that the blues as well as rock & roll are alive and here to stay
item.name: Enjoy FREE, Live music kayaking on the Merrimack
